result.execSummary:
The defendant Manuel Valencia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $368  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SH. Not to be in 100 blk of Kennedy Heights Madison, WI. Not use/possess alcohol.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

Rest. order received, waiting 7 bus. days for DA response
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Status conference on June 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant in court with Attorney Jon Oliver Helland.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Manuel Valencia in court with attorney Jon Oliver Helland. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin.Atty Helland has not received all the discovery yet and asks for set over of trial but will likely reach an agreement.  Since no agreement at this time ct. grants set over of trial dates of 4-4-2016 but will set a new STC/JS/JT.

Defendant in court with Attorney Jon Oliver Helland.  Emily L. Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Manuel Valencia in court with attorney Jon Oliver Helland. Prosecuting Atty Emily L. Thompson appeared for State of Wisconsin. Leave on trial calendar.
Atty Helland appointed as successor counsel to replace Atty Burke; Defendant has new charges in Case No. 15CF2623; Court will set another FPT and reschedule dates for JS/JT

CASH BOND SET- DEF TERMINATED FROM BMP
$1,000 pr case
- It is ordered that the def is terminated from BMP and bail is reinstated in the amount of $1,000 per case. If the def posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jai, the Sheriff is directed to notify BMP. If the def is out of custody, supervision by BMP is required to enforce conditions of release and the def shall report to BMP by 10:00am on the business day following release from jail.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Shannon H.
- Defendant may have 3rd party contact with Raquel V for the sole purpose of arranging child visitation 
- Defendant shall not be in the 100 block of Kennedy Heights in Madison, WI.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

It is ordered that the def is terminated from BMP and bail is reinstated in the amount of $1,000 per case. If the def posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jai, the Sheriff is directed to notify BMP. If the def is out of custody, supervision by BMP is required to enforce conditions of release and the def shall report to BMP by 10:00am on the business day following release from jail.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Shannon H.
- Defendant may have 3rd party contact with Raquel V for the sole purpose of arranging child visitation 
- Defendant shall not be in the 100 block of Kennedy Heights in Madison, WI.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $1000.00 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Stephanie R Hilton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
